<Link id="l00001" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1"><Highlight kind="comment">//===- LoopFlatten.cpp - Loop flattening pass------------------------------===//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00002" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00003" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Part of the LLVM Project, under the Apache License v2.0 with LLVM Exceptions.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00004" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// See https://llvm.org/LICENSE.txt for license information.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00005" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// SPDX-License-Identifier: Apache-2.0 WITH LLVM-exception</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00006" /><CodeLine lineNumber="6"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00007" /><CodeLine lineNumber="7"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00008" /><CodeLine lineNumber="8"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00009" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This pass flattens pairs nested loops into a single loop.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00010" /><CodeLine lineNumber="10"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00011" /><CodeLine lineNumber="11"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The intention is to optimise loop nests like this, which together access an</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00012" /><CodeLine lineNumber="12"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// array linearly:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00013" /><CodeLine lineNumber="13"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00014" /><CodeLine lineNumber="14"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   for (int i = 0; i &lt; N; ++i)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00015" /><CodeLine lineNumber="15"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     for (int j = 0; j &lt; M; ++j)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00016" /><CodeLine lineNumber="16"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//       f(A&#91;i&#42;M+j&#93;);</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00017" /><CodeLine lineNumber="17"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00018" /><CodeLine lineNumber="18"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// into one loop:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00019" /><CodeLine lineNumber="19"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00020" /><CodeLine lineNumber="20"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   for (int i = 0; i &lt; (N&#42;M); ++i)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00021" /><CodeLine lineNumber="21"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     f(A&#91;i&#93;);</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00022" /><CodeLine lineNumber="22"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00023" /><CodeLine lineNumber="23"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// It can also flatten loops where the induction variables are not used in the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00024" /><CodeLine lineNumber="24"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// loop. This is only worth doing if the induction variables are only used in an</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00025" /><CodeLine lineNumber="25"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// expression like i&#42;M+j. If they had any other uses, we would have to insert a</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="26"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// div/mod to reconstruct the original values, so this wouldn&#39;t be profitable.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="27"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="28"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We also need to prove that N&#42;M will not overflow. The preferred solution is</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="29"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// to widen the IV, which avoids overflow checks, so that is tried first. If</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="30"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the IV cannot be widened, then we try to determine that this new tripcount</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="31"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// expression won&#39;t overflow.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="32"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00033" /><CodeLine lineNumber="33"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Q: Does LoopFlatten use SCEV?</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="34"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Short answer: Yes and no.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="35"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="36"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Long answer:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="37"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// For this transformation to be valid, we require all uses of the induction</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="38"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// variables to be linear expressions of the form i&#42;M+j. The different Loop</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="39"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// APIs are used to get some loop components like the induction variable,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="40"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// compare statement, etc. In addition, we do some pattern matching to find the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="41"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// linear expressions and other loop components like the loop increment. The</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="42"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// latter are examples of expressions that do use the induction variable, but</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="43"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// are safe to ignore when we check all uses to be of the form i&#42;M+j. We keep</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="44"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// track of all of this in bookkeeping struct FlattenInfo.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="45"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We assume the loops to be canonical, i.e. starting at 0 and increment with</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// 1 This makes RHS of the compare the loop tripcount (with the right</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="47"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// predicate). We use SCEV to then sanity check that this tripcount matches</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="48"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// with the tripcount as computed by SCEV.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="49"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="50"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="105" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/anonymous-loopflatten-cpp-"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">namespace </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">&#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="106"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We require all uses of both induction variables to match this pattern:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="107"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="108"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   (OuterPHI &#42; InnerTripCount) + InnerPHI</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="109"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="110"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// I.e., it needs to be a linear expression of the induction variables and the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="111"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// inner loop trip count. We keep track of all different expressions on which</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="112"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// checks will be performed in this bookkeeping struct.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="113"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00276" /><CodeLine lineNumber="276"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// After widening the IVs, a trunc instruction might have been introduced,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00278" /><CodeLine lineNumber="278"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a92ca992e52dddc420f4b069cae06dfbe">isa&lt;TruncInst&gt;</a>(U)) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00279" /><CodeLine lineNumber="279"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (!U-&gt;hasOneUse())</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00280" /><CodeLine lineNumber="280"><Highlight kind="normal">          </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00281" /><CodeLine lineNumber="281"><Highlight kind="normal">        U = &#42;U-&gt;user&#95;begin();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00282" /><CodeLine lineNumber="282"><Highlight kind="normal">      &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00283" /><CodeLine lineNumber="283"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00284" /><CodeLine lineNumber="284"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If the use is in the compare (which is also the condition of the inner</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00285" /><CodeLine lineNumber="285"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// branch) then the compare has been altered by another transformation e.g</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00286" /><CodeLine lineNumber="286"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// icmp ult %inc, tripcount -&gt; icmp ult %j, tripcount-1, where tripcount is</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00287" /><CodeLine lineNumber="287"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// a constant. Ignore this use as the compare gets removed later anyway.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00288" /><CodeLine lineNumber="288"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (<a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-loopflatten-cpp-/flatteninfo/#ae66f1f5a4030c6984644f3590ff729aa">isInnerLoopTest</a>(U)) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00290" /><CodeLine lineNumber="290"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">continue</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00446" /><CodeLine lineNumber="446"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Find increment and trip count.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00447" /><CodeLine lineNumber="447"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// There are exactly 2 incoming values to the induction phi; one from the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00450" /><CodeLine lineNumber="450"><Highlight kind="normal">  Increment =</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00454" /><CodeLine lineNumber="454"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/debug-h/#a196897517069dda1bdb549e24468f7d7">LLVM&#95;DEBUG</a>(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a7c46c742c31be54870e2038048e6b391">dbgs</a>() &lt;&lt; </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;Could not find valid increment\\n&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00456" /><CodeLine lineNumber="456"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00457" /><CodeLine lineNumber="457"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The trip count is the RHS of the compare. If this doesn&#39;t match the trip</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00458" /><CodeLine lineNumber="458"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// count computed by SCEV then this is because the trip count variable</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00459" /><CodeLine lineNumber="459"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// has been widened so the types don&#39;t match, or because it is a constant and</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00460" /><CodeLine lineNumber="460"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// another transformation has changed the compare (e.g. icmp ult %inc,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00461" /><CodeLine lineNumber="461"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// tripcount -&gt; icmp ult %j, tripcount-1), or both.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00462" /><CodeLine lineNumber="462"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/x86partialreduction-cpp/#a87b8bfbbe9d8f7146d7f20a5fb42efd0">RHS</a> = Compare-&gt;getOperand(1);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00463" /><CodeLine lineNumber="463"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00464" /><CodeLine lineNumber="464"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="#a11a65ce1550eac260dca320a7028328e">verifyTripCount</a>(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/x86partialreduction-cpp/#a87b8bfbbe9d8f7146d7f20a5fb42efd0">RHS</a>, L, IterationInstructions, InductionPHI, TripCount,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00465" /><CodeLine lineNumber="465"><Highlight kind="normal">                         Increment, BackBranch, SE, IsWidened);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00466" /><CodeLine lineNumber="466"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00467" /><CodeLine lineNumber="467"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00468" /><CodeLine lineNumber="468" lineLink="#aadc8ada3f35f60d30e774a6daf23d02f"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="#aadc8ada3f35f60d30e774a6daf23d02f">checkPHIs</a>(<a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-loopflatten-cpp-/flatteninfo/#aedc7147c1826fa149adf71b1d50991b5">FlattenInfo</a> &amp;FI, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targettransforminfo">TargetTransformInfo</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#aa0d69e81725c10fa5407f0bf34462068">TTI</a>) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00469" /><CodeLine lineNumber="469"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// All PHIs in the inner and outer headers must either be:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00470" /><CodeLine lineNumber="470"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// - The induction PHI, which we are going to rewrite as one induction in</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00471" /><CodeLine lineNumber="471"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   the new loop. This is already checked by findLoopComponents.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00472" /><CodeLine lineNumber="472"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// - An outer header PHI with all incoming values from outside the loop.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00473" /><CodeLine lineNumber="473"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   LoopSimplify guarantees we have a pre-header, so we don&#39;t need to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00474" /><CodeLine lineNumber="474"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   worry about that here.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00475" /><CodeLine lineNumber="475"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// - Pairs of PHIs in the inner and outer headers, which implement a</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00476" /><CodeLine lineNumber="476"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   loop-carried dependency that will still be valid in the new loop. To</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00477" /><CodeLine lineNumber="477"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   be valid, this variable must be modified only in the inner loop.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00478" /><CodeLine lineNumber="478"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00479" /><CodeLine lineNumber="479"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The set of PHI nodes in the outer loop header that we know will still be</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00480" /><CodeLine lineNumber="480"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// valid after the transformation. These will not need to be modified (with</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00481" /><CodeLine lineNumber="481"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the exception of the induction variable), but we do need to check that</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00482" /><CodeLine lineNumber="482"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// there are no unsafe PHI nodes.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00483" /><CodeLine lineNumber="483"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallptrset">SmallPtrSet&lt;PHINode &#42;, 4&gt;</a> SafeOuterPHIs;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00485" /><CodeLine lineNumber="485"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00486" /><CodeLine lineNumber="486"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Check that all PHI nodes in the inner loop header match one of the valid</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00487" /><CodeLine lineNumber="487"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// patterns.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00488" /><CodeLine lineNumber="488"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/phinode">PHINode</a> &amp;InnerPHI : FI.InnerLoop-&gt;getHeader()-&gt;phis()) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00489" /><CodeLine lineNumber="489"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The induction PHIs break these rules, and that&#39;s OK because we treat</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00490" /><CodeLine lineNumber="490"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// them specially when doing the transformation.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00491" /><CodeLine lineNumber="491"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (&amp;InnerPHI == FI.InnerInductionPHI)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00492" /><CodeLine lineNumber="492"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">continue</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00496" /><CodeLine lineNumber="496"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Each inner loop PHI node must have two incoming values/blocks - one</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00497" /><CodeLine lineNumber="497"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// from the pre-header, and one from the latch.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00504" /><CodeLine lineNumber="504"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The incoming value from the outer loop must be the PHI node in the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00556" /><CodeLine lineNumber="556"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Check for instructions in the outer but not inner loop. If any of these</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00557" /><CodeLine lineNumber="557"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// have side-effects then this transformation is not legal, and if there is</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00558" /><CodeLine lineNumber="558"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// a significant amount of code here which can&#39;t be optimised out that it&#39;s</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00561" /><CodeLine lineNumber="561"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instructioncost">InstructionCost</a> RepeatedInstrCost = 0;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00573" /><CodeLine lineNumber="573"><Highlight kind="normal">      &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00574" /><CodeLine lineNumber="574"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The execution count of the outer loop&#39;s iteration instructions</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00575" /><CodeLine lineNumber="575"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// (increment, compare and branch) will be increased, but the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00576" /><CodeLine lineNumber="576"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// equivalent instructions will be removed from the inner loop, so</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00578" /><CodeLine lineNumber="578"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (IterationInstructions.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallptrsetimpl/#a1f475b0df44ebd7169e720fa1bf9169e">count</a>(&amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a>))</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00580" /><CodeLine lineNumber="580"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The unconditional branch to the inner loop&#39;s header will turn into</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00581" /><CodeLine lineNumber="581"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// a fall-through, so adds no cost.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00582" /><CodeLine lineNumber="582"><Highlight kind="normal">      <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/branchinst">BranchInst</a> &#42;Br = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a22eeee01734061ac1b31ccd994c49eef">dyn&#95;cast&lt;BranchInst&gt;</a>(&amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00583" /><CodeLine lineNumber="583"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (Br &amp;&amp; Br-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/branchinst/#ad56f6a9b5cd05940017c4544df48bc30">isUnconditional</a>() &amp;&amp;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00584" /><CodeLine lineNumber="584"><Highlight kind="normal">          Br-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/branchinst/#aa05da2b94b366573d1651d5b163c521e">getSuccessor</a>(0) == FI.InnerLoop-&gt;getHeader())</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00585" /><CodeLine lineNumber="585"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">continue</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00586" /><CodeLine lineNumber="586"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Multiplies of the outer iteration variable and inner iteration</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00587" /><CodeLine lineNumber="587"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// count will be optimised out.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00917" /><CodeLine lineNumber="917"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00918" /><CodeLine lineNumber="918"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Check if we can widen the induction variables to avoid overflow checks.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00919" /><CodeLine lineNumber="919"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> CanFlatten = <a href="#a0fa90c2a513cc9801d885d999ddac777">CanWidenIV</a>(FI, DT, LI, SE, AC, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#aa0d69e81725c10fa5407f0bf34462068">TTI</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00920" /><CodeLine lineNumber="920"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00921" /><CodeLine lineNumber="921"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// It can happen that after widening of the IV, flattening may not be</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00922" /><CodeLine lineNumber="922"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// possible/happening, e.g. when it is deemed unprofitable. So bail here if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00923" /><CodeLine lineNumber="923"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// that is the case.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00924" /><CodeLine lineNumber="924"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// TODO: IV widening without performing the actual flattening transformation</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00925" /><CodeLine lineNumber="925"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// is not ideal. While this codegen change should not matter much, it is an</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00926" /><CodeLine lineNumber="926"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// unnecessary change which is better to avoid. It&#39;s unlikely this happens</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00927" /><CodeLine lineNumber="927"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// often, because if it&#39;s unprofitibale after widening, it should be</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00928" /><CodeLine lineNumber="928"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// unprofitabe before widening as checked in the first round of checks. But</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00929" /><CodeLine lineNumber="929"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// &#39;RepeatedInstructionThreshold&#39; is set to only 2, which can probably be</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00930" /><CodeLine lineNumber="930"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// relaxed. Because this is making a code change (the IV widening, but not</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00931" /><CodeLine lineNumber="931"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the flattening), we return true here.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00932" /><CodeLine lineNumber="932"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (FI.Widened &amp;&amp; !CanFlatten)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00933" /><CodeLine lineNumber="933"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">true</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00934" /><CodeLine lineNumber="934"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00935" /><CodeLine lineNumber="935"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If we have widened and can perform the transformation, do that here.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00936" /><CodeLine lineNumber="936"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (CanFlatten)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00937" /><CodeLine lineNumber="937"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="#a5e53eb62d81882a5586764e2a9378a49">DoFlattenLoopPair</a>(FI, DT, LI, SE, AC, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#aa0d69e81725c10fa5407f0bf34462068">TTI</a>, U, MSSAU);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00938" /><CodeLine lineNumber="938"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00939" /><CodeLine lineNumber="939"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Otherwise, if we haven&#39;t widened the IV, check if the new iteration</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00940" /><CodeLine lineNumber="940"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// variable might overflow. In this case, we need to version the loop, and</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
